Reviews.Title: “Basic stuff (bed & bathroom) in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Abhi0809
Reviews.Content: The Fragrance hotels are well recognized as a "budget" hotel chain, so if you are mindful of that, there will not be many surprises (good or bad). We stayed there for just one night, and chose this hotel because we were arriving in S'pore in the afternoon and had an early morning flight to catch the next day - so did not want to blow too much money when all we needed was a place to wash up and sleep. (After checking-in, we spent the rest of the day taking a lesiurely walk along various streets, shopping centres, etc, returning at about midnight to crash in the bed. Woke up at 6.30 the next morning, got ready and left by 7.30.) The room we were in was small - just enough space to keep 2-3 luggage pieces, and I agree with some reviewers who found the bathroom to be too small. I mean, if you turn the shower on, everything from the washbasin to the toilet seat are within its "sphere of influence"! Yup, the entire bathroom gets a good washing :-) The Rose is not near any MRT ("subway/"metro" rail station) -- but there is a bus stop about 2 mins walk away from where S$1.10 or so will get you to the nearest MRT station Novena. Buses in Singapore, like the rest of everything in the country, are efficient and fun. The hotel is on the Balestier Road, so taxis are easily available. Interestingly, The Fragrance Rose and the Fragrance Balestier are next to each other (perhaps even share a wall)- I wonder why doesn't the management just combine the two! Just one grouse: the hotel reception staff are inadequately trained, and the hotel has a tendency to double-charge your credit card (they will charge the whole amount in advance when you make the booking, and may later charge your card again when you are checking out. After that, you may end up spending hours quarelling with the bank and the hotel!) So be vigilant on that front.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: CPRatna
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the hotel at 11am, placed our bags, paid for the room and asked for twin room (since there were two females, myself and my sister). Returned to the hotel at 8pm only to be told that there's only 1 double room left in the whole hotel. We were told that the twin room that we asked for has air conditioner problem. I asked to see the room, since both myself and sister are not penguins. The reception then said that the room was occupied. So I asked the reception if the twin room had air conditioner problem or occupied? Unfortunately I was not stupid enough to buy that lie. The receptionist then called the operation executive of the hotel cluster who turned out to be a toad with no manner. Instead of listening to what I had to say, he went on and about telling me that his hotel was fully booked. Enough said, I asked for a refund of payment and wanted to book into another hotel. I was told that there's not gonna be any refund given. In other words, I had to take whatever room that they had, and expected no refund if I didn't take the said room. Relented we went to the room, it was a tiny room with a stained bed sheet, a tiny bathroom with a tiny sink, a toilet bowl, and a shower head between the toilet bowl and the tiny sink (I couldn't figure out how to take shower!). On top of that, the air conditioner was very noisy. We asked for extra pillows and blankets, which didn't help. There's no way we would stay in the hotel that we couldn't take a shower. We decided to stay in other hotel nonetheless. And since we couldn't get any refund, we left our bags in the room. And our father slept in the room for a few hours, he didn't believe in wasting money away. In the morning we took our bags and father who hadn't showered, returned the key to the reception and got the hell out of that hotel. Never again I would step a foot in that place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much ... besides access to bus”
Reviews.Author: ekalagam
Reviews.Content: ... do not stay here if you dont like narrow room, narrow bathroom. ... do not stay here if you think all staff are helpful and nice (hiks we got those two types staff, a nice and helpful staff and a staff only say "sorry" which means didnt want to help us) ... do not stay if you tall because the beds in the room we stayed just like sofa. ... do not expect all rooms have windows.... but please consider for access to all "must see" visit in singapore ... because the hotel is near to bus stop and we could continue to anywhere we like in short time ... for example to sentosa island from this hotel by bus we could go there in 20 minutes ... 30 minutes to airport.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: fallen_angel024
Reviews.Content: the only good thing about this hotel is the location....it is conveniently located near bus stops and a hawker's area... aside from this, as soon as you enter, the lobby is small, if several people are standing you'd better open the door and stand outside...there is only one person in their lobby, so if they can only attend to one guest at a time... the room is shabby, paint peeling off the walls, ceiling is dirty, bed is lumpy and only one person can walk around the room, unless you want to bump into each other... for 135sgd, better stay in the value hotel across the road...

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Mason B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, we were after somewhere fairly cheap but not too far from the centre on the city. Good value for money, only downside is that it was a bit of a hike to the nearest MRT station Novena but we knew that before we booked so no big deal, only a $3 taxi ride from the station if available (most of the time there was a queue at the taxi rank. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajiv_report
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel. Staff was friendly and was able to guide us to visit places of attractions. Rooms are too small to stay. But think that is the trend if you are looking to stay in budget hotel in Singapore. Was located centrally, close to Little India, Mustafa, and CBD. Little far from MRT station. Travelled by public transport in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: jayivy
Reviews.Content: Fragrance Rose Hotel is a nice place to stay if you need a hotel just for sleeping. There are many convenient stores around and eateries as well. The MRT station (Novena) is quite far and we were afraid to take the bus since we don't know where to get off. Cris the front desk personnel is very friendly and accommodating. Affordable rate but transportation like MRT is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend Fragrance Rose Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: metalchocobo
Reviews.Content: This is my first review here. The hotel was so bad that I'm compelled to write a review for it. The check in time was rather late at 3 PM, no exception. There was a cockroach on the headboard. The sheets were stained w/ (sexual?) fluids. There were no windows in the room. The shower area is shared with the toilet and the sink. (When you take a shower, almost everything but the ceiling gets wet.) The towels was rather small, thin, and worn out that they should use them for wiping/cleaning dirty stuff instead. The room is really tiny; we cannot lay our suitcases on the floor. When we checked in on Sunday, the place was crawling with people--who appeared to be horny men and hookers (I could be wrong). Things got better on weekdays during daytime but at late night the men and hooker scene returned. (From reading other reviews, it seems that many Fragrance hotels are more like cheap motels/rooms/places for people to complete their sexual transactions/trades. I thought by not staying at one of their Geylang locations would avoid this issue. Apparently, I was wrong.) The receptionist at the hotel on the first day was alright, but the receptionist on the day we checked out was rather nasty. She was smoking outside and we had to wait for her. When we asked her to call a cab to the airport for us, she dialed a # then hung up immediately saying the # was busy. She said that we should just wait for a cab to drop off a passenger, then there she went outside again to smoke. If you must visit Singapore and are only willing to pay for cheap motels, you might as well go for the cheaper Fragrance hotels in the Geylang vicinity instead. Paying for more expensive Fragrance hotel branches in other non-Geylang regions do not get you away from the sex trade scene. All in all, I have much better luck at budget hotels in other countries. In Japan where things are considered to be pricey like Singapore, at least the cheap hotels (I've stayed at 3 different cheap hotels in Japan) are not cheap on windows, separation of the toilet and shower sections, cleanliness, and hospitality. Based on the very very poor and pricey accommodation in Singapore alone, for an Asian destination, I rather visit Japan, Hong Kong, or Thailand instead. I do NOT and will not recommend Fragrance Hotel Rose to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “so smaller than we expected”
Reviews.Author: vtv.anh
Reviews.Content: I read and i know it is small hotel, but i cant image the rooms are so smaller than that. I booked via Agoda, when i showed them my voucher, they did surprise !!! OH MY... I paid for confirming everything bfore arrive, but when i arrived, i must explain eveything, after that, i called to Agoda, and finally, i got my rooms for my group of 4 persons after 40 mins waiting. Thnks GOD

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but it works and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RacingAl
Reviews.Content: This is Singapore. If you want a normal sized hotel room with a normal sized bathroom you should be looking in a price range 2 - 3 times the rate you will pay here. If however you are looking for a bed and somewhere to wash and you plan to be out enjoying Singapore all day I have no hesitation recommending this place as very good value for money, but, don't be under any illusion about how basic the room is. I had a superior room but its hard to imagine what would be removed to make the room standard, maybe a smaller bed. My room had a good size bed which occupied about 75% of the floor space in the main room. There was a small cupboard high up above the bed, a small bedside cabinet with drawer and a small desk with one drawer. There was no wardrobe but two hooks with hangers on one wall. I packed extra hangers which turned out to be a good move. There was just room to put my suitcase between the end of the bed and the wall. The bathroom is basically a wet room. It has a sink (no surround), toilet and shower head sticking out from the wall. There is no shower bowl or shower curtain. When you use the shower the toilet and sink will get wet as will the whole floor of the room, there is no way to avoid this and you are not meant to avoid it, this is how the bathroom works. This does mean you need to think a bit about how you use the shower or it would be easy to get a lot of water all over both rooms. I would seriously think twice about booking this hotel is you are on the extra large or obese side. I think larger people could have a genuine problem using this size of bathroom. The area is fairly limited but there is one nice friendly bar just along the road and some KTV lounges nearby with flashy looking hostesses but I think you need to be Chinese to get the best from these. There are a few, local style eating places and a couple of convenience stores. You can catch a 124 bus (forget the MRT, too far away) from across the road to the top of Orchard Road to connect with City Centre or transport to other parts of the Island, cost S$1 journey time 10 - 15 minutes. Front desk staff seemed efficient although I did not use their services much. I do not use a computer when travelling so cannot comment on Wi-Fi access. The hotel is quite noisy. Sound seems to travel very easily along the corridors and through the building from floors above. I heard a lot of plumbing noises and cleaning activities when I was lying in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not on my recommendation list”
Reviews.Author: AsiaTravellerJakarta
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 1 night, one for my mother and one that I wanted to share with a friend who was visiting me in Asia. It turned out that the double room was extremely small and didn't even have a window (!), I felt like in a prison cell. Maybe it might have worked for one person, but the room ws definitely too small for 2. Too add to our bad luck, the hotel was fully booked, no options. My friend found a better room in the hotel next door and my mother and me swapped rooms (since she just wanted to sleep and didn't mind the missing window for 1 night. The other room had a tiny window at a height of approx. 2 meters, at least an improvement compared to the hole before. The bathroom was so narrow that it was impossible to take a shower without completely wetting the toilet set. Positive: everything was clean and the WiFi was working. Better only consider staying here if you did not make a reservation and are able to have a look at the room first.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: jedimaster10248
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel because of a stopover. The taxi driver brought us here because we were looking for a cheap hotel. Once we entered the room it was so small. Now we were a family of three and we got the cheapest room which was a one bedroom so I don't know how big a two or three bedroom is but if you are afraid of small spaces don't go to this hotel or any cheap hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok for the location and hotel's amenities. Not recommend to the family.”
Reviews.Author: je_dizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on weekend and found that Balestier Road is the lady market during the daytime on weekends. It is ok if you don't mind because the location is not too bad. You can take the bus no.124 at the bus stop opposite to the hotel to reach Orchard Road, China Town and Clark Quay and the bus no.21 or 131 at the bus stop on hotel side to reach the Novena MRT Station which takes approximately 15 minutes. There are some restaurants and 24 hours minimarts around. The room looks clean at the first sight because of its hotel standardization with bedsheet and amenities but if you check carefully, the bed accessories are smelly. The room is very tiny also the bahtroom, no windows and the wall is thin so you can hear the noise but there are the hair dryer, liquid soap, towel and complimentary coffee. The hotel is absolutely not recommended for family and children.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a box”
Reviews.Author: thedz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3D2N in Fragrance hotel Rose which located along Balliester Road. The room is too small. No cupboard(cabinet) to keep our things, thats why our clothes are lying on the floor. Toilet is small as well. The whole is get wet when you have your shower. For some reason bad smell coming from the drainage inside the toilet, thats why they send us air freshener since there is no available room for us to transfer. Otherwise the place is clean, pillows, bedsheet and towels are purely white and change everyday with your presense. They will not clean your room if your not around. No free breakfast, Wifi available for $5/hour. Check in is very late 3PM. This place is not recommended for claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “just for reservation”
Reviews.Author: sophiachad
Reviews.Content: we went to fragant hotel- ROSE to book for a friend that will be coming to singapore for 1 night only. it is recommended by a friend also here in singapore that their friend stayed there for 3 nights. they said the price is very reasonable and the facilities is clean and ok. but when we went we went there 14 September around 6.30-7pm the receptionist there a girl named jaimahh? i think...her name started with "J". my gosh, i'm so disappointed cause she is very rude to her customer. one girl who is staying there ask them if she has some phone calls from a friend. and the receptionist said that "NO MA'AM! NO MA'AM! YOU DON'T HAVE ANY CALLS! The funny things is she never checked if she really has any calls or not. then we inquire if there's a bus going to orchard, then with a high tone voice she said. JUST CROSS THE ROAD AND TAKE 124. It's a customer service business! she can say things nicely, like...i'm sorry ma'am but you don't have any incoming calls. or yes there is a bus going to orchard just take bus 124 accross the road. i will never recommend this hotel to my friends. but of course, i haven't been to the other fragrant hotel so i'm just particular with the ROSE branch. you must improve your courtesy to your customer please...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: ananddevaiah
Reviews.Content: The place was excellent for the price we paid. stayed there for 5 N and 6 D . the service was great with change of linnen and cleaning always on time.the rooms are indeed very small .... but as i said for the budget pricing and the service it is a great deal. THE BEST point is that it is situated bang in the centre of town and very easily reached. The reception is a little slow but nonetheless responsive. The downide... checkin at 3 pm... very very inconvenient. overall great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too small but good for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: NotSoBudget-Eva
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews about this hotel and decided to try as this is the best rates that i can afford for hotel that's near to Orchard. Its easy access to take a bus from the hotel. Bus station just in front of the hotel. Hotel are very near to Novena Shopping Mall. The bathroom is really really SMALL!!! After shower, the whole bathroom will be wet. Room are quite small but enough for traveller. They provide towel, toothbrush and soap which is quite good I have booked through Agoda and found out the price reflected in my credit card was abit higher than price showed in internet. So, becareful when you booked thru Agoda!!

Reviews.Title: “budget means tiny insingapore”
Reviews.Author: travelwhizdel
Reviews.Content: The moment u enter there is no one to help u with the luggage , thats ok but. there are no cupboards in the rooms for the stuff also. then the bathroom is almost microscopic,really tiny even the bathroom door opens folding(there is no space).the room is almost the size of the bed ony 8 inches extra on the foot side and 26 inches on the getting off side the other 2 sides are stuck to the wall.the rooms are sealed but there is good exhaust and u dont get the stuffy damp feeling. the staff is good and helpful.we stayed for 14 days . its definetly clean and there are few grocery stores and a pizza restaurand nearby. stay there only if u cum for short time or are out most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Neat and worth for the cheapest price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Sanesh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Singapore for a 3 night stay. Our accommodation requirement was only to sleep and keep all our luggages safely; as all through out the day we spent our time visiting places. So for this requirement Hotel Fragrance - Rose suited well for us for a reasonably cheap price where many other hotels are very expensive. The room is very small which was not an issue for us as most of the time we were out. The room was very clean. I booked this through [-----] GPS Way Point 1.31837N, 103.85776E

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ryan2000
Reviews.Content: Don't................for the love of god................EVER STAY HERE! Put it this way, these are the type of hotels that they rent out by the hour which really didn't sit well with me when i found stains on my bed sheets and pillows on the first night. If it wasn't for singapore being totally booked out & the fact that i didn't arrive till midnight i would have been out of this place in a flash................. FILTH!

HotelInfo.Name: Fragrance Hotel - Rose
HotelInfo.Address: 263 Balestier Road, Singapore 329715, Singapore
